question: From which nation the Republic of Congo gained independence in 1960?
explanation: The Republic of Congo gained independence from France in 1960. It was a part of the French colony of Equatorial Africa. It came under French sovereignty in 1880. In 1908, France organised French Equatorial Africa comprising Middle Congo, Gabon, and the modern Central African Republic and designated Brazaville as its capital. It was the symbolic capital of Free France during the German occupation of France in World War II.
